step1.sentence: Many traditional crafts are dying out because younger generations prefer modern technology over learning old techniques.

step2.story: The village elders worried that their ancient language would die out with them. They began recording stories and songs, hoping to pass the knowledge on before it was gone forever.

step3.story: Deep in the rainforest, researchers discovered that a rare species of frog was on the verge of dying out. Habitat destruction had reduced their population to just a few dozen individuals scattered across remote valleys. The scientists set up a breeding program, carefully monitoring each frog's health and behavior. Years of effort slowly paid off as the population began to recover. Today, the frog serves as a symbol of what conservation can achieve when people act before a species completely dies out.

meaning.realUsageKo: 생물 종이 멸종되거나, 관습·언어·전통 같은 것이 더 이상 존재하지 않게 될 때 사용한다. 서서히 소멸되는 과정을 강조하는 표현이다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'die'(죽다)와 'out'(완전히)의 결합으로, '완전히 꺼져 죽다'는 뜻에서 유래했으며 불이 완전히 꺼지는 이미지에서 비롯되었다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순한 소멸보다 점진적이고 돌이킬 수 없는 사라짐을 암시하며, 종종 아쉬움이나 경고의 뉘앙스를 담아 사용된다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: If nothing changes, this tradition will die out within a generation.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 아무것도 바뀌지 않는다면, 이 전통은 한 세대 안에 사라질 것이다.
